alert.note: Alert for Northern Columbia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 1:40PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN BAKER... NORTHEASTERN COLUMBIA...SOUTHEASTERN WARE...SOUTHEASTERN CLINCH AND SOUTH CENTRAL CHARLTON COUNTIES THROUGH 215 PM EDT... At 140 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northwest of Taylor, or 13 miles southeast of Fargo, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts around 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Baker, northeastern Columbia, southeastern Ware, southeastern Clinch and south central Charlton Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
